intro: Amyema timorana, commonly known as the Timor mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the genus Erythrophleum. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains seeds dispersed by birds. Amyema timorana plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and providing food for various wildlife species.
